Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: OUTPUT DEVICES - Definition of output device: Monitor, Printer speaker, plotter -Features and uses of output device -Monitor:- structure types and functions I-e Monochrome and colour.

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER ACTIVITIES - Leads students to define output devices -displays the output devices in for students -Leads students to list output devices. -States the features of monitors. STUDENT ACTIVITIES - Identify the output devices as displayed -Switch on the monitor

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: OUTPUT DEVICES:-printers, types - Impact Dot matrix printers, line printers, character printers -NON-Impact. Inkjet Printers, Laser jet Printers, Thermal Printers -Comparative study of common printers.

Learning Activities.value: TEACHERS ACTIVITIES - Displays different types of printers. -State the features and their differences. -Guides students to operate the printer. STUDENT ACTIVITIES  Operate the printer under teacher’s guidance -Copy notes from the chalkboard into their notes

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS - Printers, charts, Computer system.

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: COMPUTER SYSTEM SOFTWARE - Definition of software Types of software: System software( operating system, translator, tools/utility program) and Application software

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES  - Leads students to define computer software -Guides students to name different types of software. STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES -  Identify operating systems displayed on the screen.

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS -  Computer with windows or Unix operating system installed.

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: COMPUTER SYSTEM SOFTWARE  -Examples of operating system e.g. Graphical user interface (GUI), MS windows, Linux. -Command line(Linux, Microsoft, disk operating system (DOS) -Examples of translators e.g. Assemblers, compilers, interpreters

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Leads students to list examples of operating system -Displays operating system environment on the screen.STUDENTS'S ACTIVITIES - Participate in class discussions -Identify DOS directory at the C. prompt

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS - Computer with DOS installed charts and pictures.

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: COMPUTER APPLICATION SOFTWARE - Examples of utility programs(Editors, Anti-virus) -Definition of application software -Types of application software( User application program i.e program written by numbers) and (Application packages) -Categories of application packages e.g. word processing, spread sheet, graphics, database, games.

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Lead students to define application software -Leads students to state categories of application packages.STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES - Identify application packages as displayed

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS - Application packages, charts and pictures

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: COMPUTER APPLICATIN SOFTWARE - Packages for specialized areas: Accounting software, Payroll Programs, Banking Software, Educational Management Software, Statistical Packages, and Hospital Management Software etc.

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Leads students to list packages for specialized areas. STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES - Identify different packages for specialized areas

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE  -Definition of programming language -Levels of programming language: Machine Language(ML), -Low Level Language( LLL), High Level Language( HLL) -Features of each level

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Leads students to define programming language -Displays a stored programming language on the screen -States the various programming language levels. -Describe features of each programming language level. STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES  -Identify a programming language when displayed on the screen -Describe the features of each level of programming language.

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS - Computer, A high level language stored or installed e.g. BASIC environment.

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE - Examples of programming language -Comparison of levels of programming language

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Guides students to compare the various levels of programming language. STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES - Compare the various levels of programming languages.

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: BASIC PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE - Meaning of “BASIC” (Beginners All-Purpose Symbolic Instructional Code) -Basic Statement: LET, READ, INPUT, DATA, END,L PRINT -Basic character

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Leads students to state the full meaning of ‘BASIC’ -List Basic character set -List some Basic statement,STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES - State the full meaning of ‘BASIC’ List BASIC character set and some BASIC statements.

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS - Computer with BASIC program installed, chart

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: BASIC PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE - BASIC Arithmetic operator -BASIC Arithmetic expressions

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Writes BASIC notations for arithmetic expressions -Leads students to write simple BASIC program. STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES  -Write simple BASIC program -Run BASIC program installed, chart.

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS - Computer with BASIC program installed, chart.

Subject: Computer Studies
Topics: BASIC PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE - Evaluation of arithmetic expression -Simple BASIC program

Learning Activities.value: TEACHER'S ACTIVITIES - Write BASIC notations for arithmetic expressions -Guides students to run BASIC program on computer.STUDENT'S ACTIVITIES - Write simple BASIC program -Run BASIC program in the computer

Learning Resources.value: RESOURCE MATERIALS - Computer with BASIC program installed
